00136 
00137 typedef struct _NPDeviceContext2D
00138 {
00139   /* Internal value used by the browser to identify this device. */
00140   void* reserved;
00141 
00142   /* A pointer to the pixel data. This data is 8-bit values in BGRA order in
00143    * memory. Each row will start |stride| bytes after the previous one.
00144    *
00145    * THIS DATA USES PREMULTIPLIED ALPHA. This means that each color channel has
00146    * been multiplied with the corresponding alpha, which makes compositing
00147    * easier. If any color channels have a value greater than the alpha value,
00148    * you'll likely get crazy colors and weird artifacts. */
00149   void* region;
00150 
00151   /* Length of each row of pixels in bytes. This may be larger than width * 4
00152    * if there is padding at the end of each row to help with alignment. */
00153   int32_t stride;
00154 
00155   /* The dirty region that the plugin has painted into the buffer. This
00156    * will be initialized to the size of the plugin image in
00157    * initializeContextPtr. The plugin can change the values to only
00158    * update portions of the image. */
00159   struct {
00160     int32_t left;
00161     int32_t top;
00162     int32_t right;
00163     int32_t bottom;
00164   } dirty;
00165 } NPDeviceContext2D;
00166

00168   void* ptr;
00169   size_t size;
00170 } NPDeviceBuffer;

00216     NPP instance,
00217     NPDeviceContext* context);

00220 /* lifetime of the context. */

00222     NPP instance,

00248 /* New experimental device API. */
00249 
00250 /* Mode for calls to NPDeviceSynchronizeContext. */
00251 typedef enum {
00252   /* Get or set locally cached state without synchronizing or communicating   */
00253   /* with the service process (or thread).                                    */
00254   NPDeviceSynchronizationMode_Cached,
00255 
00256   /* Exchanges state with service process (or thread). Does not wait for any  */
00257   /* progress before returning.                                               */
00258   NPDeviceSynchronizationMode_Immediate,
00259 
00260   /* Exchanges state with service process (or thread). Blocks caller until    */
00261   /* further progress can be made.                                            */
00262   NPDeviceSynchronizationMode_Flush
00263 } NPDeviceSynchronizationMode;

00265 /* Get the number of configs supported by a given device. */
00266 typedef NPError (*NPDeviceGetNumConfigsPtr)(NPP instance,
00267                                             int32_t* numConfigs);
00268 
00269 /* Get attribute values from a config. NPDeviceGetConfigs might return        */
00270 /* multiple configs. This function can be used to examine them to             */
00271 /* find the most suitable. For example, NPDeviceGetConfigs might return one   */
00272 /* config with antialiasing enabled and one without. This can be determined   */
00273 /* using this function.                                                       */
00274 /* Inputs:                                                                    */
00275 /*  config: The config index to extract the attributes from.                  */
00276 /*  attribList: Array of input config attribute / value pairs                 */
00277 /*              terminated with NPAttrib_End.                                 */
00278 /* Outputs:                                                                   */
00279 /*  attribList: The values paired up with each attribute are filled in        */
00280 /*              on return.                                                    */
00281 typedef NPError (*NPDeviceGetConfigAttribsPtr)(NPP instance,
00282                                                int32_t config,
00283                                                int32_t* attribList);
00284 
00285 /* Create a device context based on a particular device configuration and a   */
00286 /* list config input attributes.                                              */
00287 /* Inputs:                                                                    */
00288 /*  config: The device configuration to use.                                  */
00289 /*  attribList: NULL or an array of context specific attribute / value        */
00290 /*              pairs terminated with NPAttrib_End.                           */
00291 /* Outputs:                                                                   */
00292 /*  context: The created context.                                             */
00293 typedef NPError (*NPDeviceCreateContextPtr)(NPP instance,
00294                                             int32_t config,
00295                                             const int32_t* attribList,
00296                                             NPDeviceContext** context);
00297 
00298 /* Destroy a context.                                                         */
00299 /* Inputs:                                                                    */
00300 /*  context: The context to destroy.                                          */
00301 /*typedef NPError (*NPDestroyContext)(NPP instance,                           */
00302 /*                                    NPDeviceContext* context);              */
00303 
00304 /* This type should be cast to the type associated with the particular        */
00305 /* callback type */
00306 typedef void (*NPDeviceGenericCallbackPtr)(void);
00307 
00308 /* Register a callback with a context. Callbacks are never invoked after the  */
00309 /* associated context has been destroyed. The semantics of the particular     */
00310 /* callback type determine which thread the callback is invoked on. It might  */
00311 /* be the plugin thread, the thread RegisterCallback is invoked on or a       */
00312 /* special thread created for servicing callbacks, such as an audio thread    */
00313 /* Inputs:                                                                    */
00314 /*  callbackType: The device specific callback type                           */
00315 /*  callback: The callback to invoke. The signature varies by type. Use       */
00316 /*            NULL to unregister the callback for a particular type.          */
00317 /*  callbackData: A value that is passed to the callback function. Other      */
00318 /*                callback arguments vary by type.                            */
00319 typedef NPError (*NPDeviceRegisterCallbackPtr)(
00320     NPP instance,
00321     NPDeviceContext* context,
00322     int32_t callbackType,
00323     NPDeviceGenericCallbackPtr callback,
00324     void* callbackData);
00325 
00326 /* Callback for NPDeviceSynchronizeContext.                                   */
00327 /* Inputs:                                                                    */
00328 /*  instance: The associated plugin instance.                                 */
00329 /*  context: The context that was flushed.                                    */
00330 /*  error: Indicates success of flush operation.                              */
00331 /*  data: The completion callback data that was passed to                     */
00332 /*        NPDeviceSynchronizeContext.                                         */
00333 typedef void (*NPDeviceSynchronizeContextCallbackPtr)(
00334     NPP instance,
00335     NPDeviceContext* context,
00336     NPError error,
00337     void* data);
00338 
00339 /* Synchronize the state of a device context. Takes lists of input and output */
00340 /* attributes. Generally, the input attributes are copied into the context    */
00341 /* and the output attributes are filled in the state of the context either    */
00342 /* after (before) the synchronization depending on whether it is synchronous  */
00343 /* (asynchronous). The get the state of the context after an asynchronous     */
00344 /* synchronization, call this function a second time with Cached mode after   */
00345 /* the callback has been invoked.                                             */
00346 /* Inputs:                                                                    */
00347 /*  context: The context to synchronize.                                      */
00348 /*  mode: The type of synchronization to perform.                             */
00349 /*  inputAttribList: NULL or an array of input synchronization attribute /    */
00350 /*                   value pairs terminated with NPAttrib_End.                */
00351 /*  outputAttribList: NULL or an array of output synchronization              */
00352 /*                    attributes / uninitialized value pairs terminated       */
00353 /*                    with NPAttrib_End.                                      */
00354 /*  callback: NULL for synchronous operation or completion callback function  */
00355 /*            for asynchronous operation.                                     */
00356 /*  callbackData: Argument passed to callback function.                       */
00357 /* Outputs:                                                                   */
00358 /*  outputAttribList: The values paired up with each attribute are filled     */
00359 /*                    in on return for synchronous operation.                 */
00360 typedef NPError (*NPDeviceSynchronizeContextPtr)(
00361     NPP instance,
00362     NPDeviceContext* context,
00363     NPDeviceSynchronizationMode mode,
00364     const int32_t* inputAttribList,
00365     int32_t* outputAttribList,
00366     NPDeviceSynchronizeContextCallbackPtr callback,
00367     void* callbackData);
00368 
00369 /* All attributes shared between devices, with the exception of               */
00370 /* NPDeviceContextAttrib_End, have bit 31 set. Device specific attributes     */
00371 /* have the bit clear.                                                        */
00372 enum {
00373   /* Used to terminate arrays of attribute / value pairs. */
00374   NPAttrib_End   = 0,
00375 
00376   /* Error status of context. Non-zero means error. Shared by all devices,    */
00377   /* though error values are device specific.                                 */
00378   NPAttrib_Error = 0x80000000
00379 };
00380

00394   /* Experimental device API */
00395   NPDeviceGetNumConfigsPtr getNumConfigs;
00396   NPDeviceGetConfigAttribsPtr getConfigAttribs;
00397   NPDeviceCreateContextPtr createContext;
00398 /*  NPDeviceDestroyContextPtr destroyContext; */
00399   NPDeviceRegisterCallbackPtr registerCallback;
00400   NPDeviceSynchronizeContextPtr synchronizeContext;
00401 /*  NPDeviceCreateBufferPtr createBuffer; */
00402 /*  NPDeviceDestroyBufferPtr destroyBuffer; */
00403 /*  NPDeviceMapBufferPtr mapBuffer; */
00404 };

00520 /* Supports opening files anywhere on the system after prompting the user to
00521  * pick one.
00522  *
00523  * This API is asynchronous. It will return immediately and the user will be
00524  * prompted in parallel to pick a file. The plugin may continue to receive
00525  * events while the open file dialog is up, and may continue to paint. Plugins
00526  * may want to ignore input events between the call and the callback to avoid
00527  * reentrant behavior. If the return value is not NPERR_NO_ERROR, the callback
00528  * will NOT be executed.
00529  *
00530  * It is an error to call BrowseForFile before a previous call has executed
00531  * the callback.
00532  *
00533  * Setting the flags to "Open" requires that the file exist to allow picking.
00534  * Setting the flags to "Save" allows selecting nonexistant files (which will
00535  * then be created), and will prompt the user if they want to overwrite an
00536  * existing file if it exists.
00537  *
00538  * The plugin may specify a comma-separated list of possible mime types in
00539  * the "extensions" parameter. If no extensions are specified, the dialog box
00540  * will default to allowing all extensions. The first extension in the list
00541  * will be the default.
00542  *
00543  * TODO(brettw) On Windows the extensions traditionally include a text
00544  * description with the extension in the popup, do we want to allow this?
00545  * We should probably also allow the ability to put "All files" in the
00546  * list on Windows.
00547  *
00548  * Once the user has picked a file or has canceled the dialog box, the given
00549  * callback will be called with the results of the operation and the passed in
00550  * "user data" pointer. If the user successfully picked a file, the filename
00551  * will be non-NULL and will contain a pointer to an array of strings, one for
00552  * each file picked (the first file will be file_paths[0]). This buffer will
00553  * become invalid as soon as the call completes, so it is the plugin's
00554  * responsibility to copy the filename(sp if it needs future access to them.
00555  * A NULL file_paths in the callback means the user canceled the dialog box.
00556  *
00557  * The filename will be in UTF-8. It may not actually correspond to the actual
00558  * file on disk on a Linux system, because we'll do our best to convert it from
00559  * the filesystem's locale to UTF-8. Instead, the string will be appropriate for
00560  * displaying to the user which file they picked.
00561  * */
00562 typedef enum {
00563   NPChooseFile_Open = 1,
00564   NPChooseFile_OpenMultiple = 2,
00565   NPChooseFile_Save = 3
00566 } NPChooseFileMode;
00567 typedef void (*NPChooseFileCallback)(const char** filePaths,
00568                                      uint32_t pathCount,
00569                                      void* userData);
00570 typedef NPError (*NPChooseFilePtr)(
00571     NPP instance,
00572     const char* mimeTypes,
00573     NPChooseFileMode mode,
00574     NPChooseFileCallback callback,
00575     void* userData);
00576 
00577 typedef enum {
00578   NPCursorTypePointer = 0,
00579   NPCursorTypeCross = 1,
00580   NPCursorTypeHand = 2,

00595   NPCursorTypeNorthWestSouthEastResize = 17,

00677 // Loads a specified font table for the given font.
00678 //   table: the table in *big-endian* format, or 0 for the whole font file.
00679 //   output: a buffer of size output_length that gets the data.  can be 0, in
00680 //     which case output_length will be set to the required size in bytes.
00681 //   output_length: size of output, if it's not 0.
00682 typedef NPError (*GetFontTablePtr) (
00683     NPP instance,
00684     NPFontID id,
00685     uint32_t table,
00686     void* output,
00687     size_t* output_length);

00690 typedef NPError (*NPDestroyFontPtr) (
00691     NPP instance,
00692     NPFontID id);

00728 typedef enum _NPDeviceContext3DError {
00729   // No error has ocurred.
00730   NPDeviceContext3DError_NoError,
00731 
00732   // The size of a command was invalid.
00733   NPDeviceContext3DError_InvalidSize,
00734 
00735   // An offset was out of bounds.
00736   NPDeviceContext3DError_OutOfBounds,
00737 
00738   // A command was not recognized.
00739   NPDeviceContext3DError_UnknownCommand,
00740 
00741   // The arguments to a command were invalid.
00742   NPDeviceContext3DError_InvalidArguments,
00743 
00744   // The 3D context was lost, for example due to a power management event. The
00745   // context must be destroyed and a new one created.
00746   NPDeviceContext3DError_LostContext,
00747 
00748   // Any other error.
00749   NPDeviceContext3DError_GenericError
00750 } NPDeviceContext3DError;
00751 
00752 typedef struct _NPDeviceContext3D NPDeviceContext3D;
00753 
00754 typedef void (*NPDeviceContext3DRepaintPtr)(NPP npp,
00755                                             NPDeviceContext3D* context);
00756 
00757 // TODO(apatrick): this need not be exposed when we switch over to the new
00758 // device API. It's layout can also be implementation dependent.
00759 typedef struct _NPDeviceContext3D
00760 {
00761   void* reserved;
00762 
00763   // If true, then a flush will only complete once the get offset has advanced
00764   // on the GPU thread. If false, then the get offset might have changed but
00765   // the GPU thread will respond as quickly as possible without guaranteeing
00766   // having made any progress in executing pending commands. Set to true
00767   // to ensure that progress is made or when flushing in a loop waiting for the
00768   // GPU to reach a certain state, for example in advancing beyond a particular
00769   // token. Set to false when flushing to query the current state, for example
00770   // whether an error has occurred.
00771   bool waitForProgress;
00772 
00773   // Buffer in which commands are stored.
00774   void* commandBuffer;
00775   int32_t commandBufferSize;
00776 
00777   // Offset in command buffer reader has reached. Synchronized on flush.
00778   int32_t getOffset;
00779 
00780   // Offset in command buffer writer has reached. Synchronized on flush.
00781   int32_t putOffset;
00782 
00783   // Last processed token. Synchronized on flush.
00784   int32_t token;
00785 
00786   // Callback invoked on the main thread when the context must be repainted.
00787   // TODO(apatrick): move this out of the context struct like the rest of the
00788   // fields.
00789   NPDeviceContext3DRepaintPtr repaintCallback;
00790 
00791   // Error status. Synchronized on flush.
00792   NPDeviceContext3DError error;
00793 } NPDeviceContext3D;
00794 
00795 
00796 /* Begin 3D specific portion of experimental device API */
00797 
00798 /* Device buffer ID reserved for command buffer */
00799 enum {
00800   NP3DCommandBufferId = 0
00801 };
00802 
00803 /* 3D attributes */
00804 enum {
00805   /* Example GetConfigAttribs attributes. See EGL 1.4 spec. */
00806   /* These may be passed to GetConfigAttribs. */
00807   NP3DAttrib_BufferSize        = 0x3020,
00808   NP3DAttrib_AlphaSize         = 0x3021,
00809   NP3DAttrib_BlueSize          = 0x3022,
00810   NP3DAttrib_GreenSize         = 0x3023,
00811   NP3DAttrib_RedSize           = 0x3024,
00812   NP3DAttrib_DepthSize         = 0x3025,
00813   NP3DAttrib_StencilSize       = 0x3026,
00814   NP3DAttrib_SurfaceType       = 0x3033,
00815 
00816   /* Example CreateContext attributes. See EGL 1.4 spec. */
00817   /* These may be passed to CreateContext. */
00818   NP3DAttrib_SwapBehavior       = 0x3093,
00819   NP3DAttrib_MultisampleResolve = 0x3099,
00820 
00821   /* Size of command buffer in 32-bit entries. */
00822   /* This may be passed to CreateContext as an input or SynchronizeContext as */
00823   /* an output. */
00824   NP3DAttrib_CommandBufferSize  = 0x10000000,
00825 
00826   /* These may be passed to SynchronizeContext. */
00827 
00828   /* Offset in command buffer writer has reached. In / out.*/
00829   NP3DAttrib_PutOffset,
00830 
00831   /* Offset in command buffer reader has reached. Out only. */
00832   NP3DAttrib_GetOffset,
00833 
00834   /* Last processed token. Out only. */
00835   NP3DAttrib_Token
00836 };
00837 
00838 /* 3D callbacks */
00839 enum {
00840   /* This callback is invoked whenever the plugin must repaint everything.    */
00841   /* This might be because the window manager must repaint a window or        */
00842   /* the context has been lost, for example a power management event.         */
00843   NP3DCallback_Repaint = 1
00844 };
00845 
00846 /* Flags for NPConfig3DOutAttrib_SurfaceType */
00847 enum {
00848   NP3DSurfaceType_MultisampleResolveBox = 0x0200,
00849   NP3DSurfaceType_SwapBehaviorPreserved = 0x0400
00850 };
00851 
00852 /* Values for NPConfig3DInAttrib_SwapBehavior */
00853 enum {
00854   NP3DSwapBehavior_Preserved            = 0x3094,
00855   NP3DSwapBehavior_Destroyed            = 0x3095
00856 };
00857 
00858 /* Values for NPConfig3DInAttrib_MultisampleResolve */
00859 enum {
00860   NP3DMultisampleResolve_Default        = 0x309A,
00861   NP3DMultisampleResolve_Box            = 0x309B
00862 };

00951 /* Printing related APIs ---------------------------------------------------*/
00952 
00953 /* Defines a contiguous range of pages to be printed. Page numbers use a
00954  * zero-based index. */
00955 typedef struct _NPPrintPageNumberRange {
00956   int32_t firstPageNumber;
00957   int32_t lastPageNumber;
00958 } NPPrintPageNumberRange;
00959 
00960 /* Being a print operation. Returns the total number of pages to print at the
00961  * given printableArea size and DPI. printableArea is in points (a point is 1/72
00962  * of an inch). The plugin is expected to remember the values of printableArea
00963  * and printerDPI for use in subsequent print interface calls. These values
00964  * should be cleared in printEnd. */
00965 typedef NPError (*NPPPrintBeginPtr) (
00966     NPP instance,
00967     NPRect* printableArea,
00968     int32_t printerDPI,
00969     int32_t* numPages);
00970 /* Returns the required raster dimensions for the given page. */
00971 typedef NPError (*NPPGetRasterDimensionsPtr) (
00972     NPP instance,
00973     int32_t pageNumber,
00974     int32_t* widthInPixels,
00975     int32_t* heightInPixels);
00976 /* Prints the specified page This allows the plugin to print a raster output. */
00977 typedef NPError (*NPPPrintPageRasterPtr) (
00978     NPP instance,
00979     int32_t pageNumber,
00980     NPDeviceContext2D* printSurface);
00981 /* Ends the print operation */
00982 typedef NPError (*NPPPrintEndPtr) (NPP instance);
00983 /* Prints the specified pages as PDF. The plugin allocates the output buffer
00984  * pointed to by pdf_output using the browser-supplied NPN_MemAlloc function.
00985  * The caller is expected to free the output buffer upon success.*/
00986 typedef NPError (*NPPrintPagesAsPDFPtr)(NPP instance,
00987                                         NPPrintPageNumberRange* page_ranges,
00988                                         int32_t page_range_count,
00989                                         unsigned char** pdf_output,
00990                                         int32_t* output_size);
00991 
00992 
00993 /* TODO(sanjeevr) : Provide a vector interface for printing. We need to decide
00994  * on a vector format that can support embedded fonts. A vector format will
00995  * greatly reduce the size of the required output buffer. */
00996 
00997 typedef struct _NPPPrintExtensions {
00998   NPPPrintBeginPtr printBegin;
00999   NPPGetRasterDimensionsPtr getRasterDimensions;
01000   NPPPrintPageRasterPtr printPageRaster;
01001   NPPPrintEndPtr printEnd;
01002   NPPrintPagesAsPDFPtr printPagesAsPDF;
01003 } NPPPrintExtensions;
01004 
01005 /* Returns NULL if the plugin does not support print extensions */
01006 typedef NPPPrintExtensions* (*NPPGetPrintExtensionsPtr)(NPP instance);
01007 
01008 /* Find ---------------------------------------------------------------------*/
01009 
01010 /* Finds the given UTF-8 text starting at the current selection.  The number of
01011  * results will be updated asynchronously via numberOfFindResultsChanged.  Note
01012  * that multiple StartFind calls can happen before StopFind is called in the
01013  * case of the search term changing. */
01014 typedef NPError (*NPPStartFindPtr) (
01015     NPP instance,
01016     const char* text,
01017     bool caseSensitive);
01018 
01019 /* Go to the next/previous result. */
01020 typedef NPError (*NPPSelectFindResultPtr) (
01021     NPP instance,
01022     bool forward);
01023 
01024 /* Tells the plugin that the find operation has stopped, so it should clear
01025  * any highlighting. */
01026 typedef NPError (*NPPStopFindPtr) (
01027     NPP instance);
01028 
01029 typedef struct _NPPFindExtensions {
01030   NPPStartFindPtr startFind;
01031   NPPSelectFindResultPtr selectFindResult;
01032   NPPStopFindPtr stopFind;
01033 } NPPFindExtensions;
01034 
01035 /* Returns NULL if the plugin does not support find extensions. */
01036 typedef NPPFindExtensions* (*NPPGetFindExtensionsPtr)(NPP instance);
01037 
01038 /* Zooms plugins.  0 means reset, -1 means zoom out, and +1 means zoom in. */
01039 typedef NPError (*NPPZoomPtr) (
01040     NPP instance,
01041     int factor);
01042 
01043 typedef NPError (*NPPWidgetPropertyChangedPtr) (
01044     NPP instance,
01045     NPWidgetID id,
01046     NPWidgetProperty property);
01047 
01048 /* type of selection */
01049 typedef enum {
01050   NPSelectionTypeAny       = 0,
01051   NPSelectionTypePlainText = 1,
01052   NPSelectionTypeHTML      = 2
01053 } NPSelectionType;
01054 
01055 /* Gets the selection.  NPERR_GENERIC_ERROR is returned if nothing is selected.
01056  * 'type' is both an input and output parameter.  The caller can request a
01057  * specific type, and if the plugin can't provide it, it will return
01058  * NPERR_GENERIC_ERROR.  Or the caller can specify NPSelectionTypeAny to let the
01059  * plugin pick the best format for the data.  The result is returned in a buffer
01060  * that's owned by the caller and which is allocated using NPN_MemAlloc.  If no
01061  * data is available, NPERR_GENERIC_ERROR is returned. */
01062 typedef NPError (*NPPGetSelectionPtr) (
01063     NPP instance,
01064     NPSelectionType* type,
01065     void** data);
01066 
01067 typedef struct _NPPExtensions {
01068   NPPGetPrintExtensionsPtr getPrintExtensions;
01069   NPPGetFindExtensionsPtr getFindExtensions;
01070   NPPZoomPtr zoom;
01071   NPPWidgetPropertyChangedPtr widgetPropertyChanged;
01072   NPPGetSelectionPtr getSelection;
01073 } NPPExtensions;
